com.mvp4g.client.history
Class PlaceService

java.lang.Object
  com.mvp4g.client.history.PlaceService
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ValueChangeHandler<java.lang.String>, com.google.gwt.event.shared.EventHandler
public class PlaceService
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ValueChangeHandler<java.lang.String>

Place Service defines the connection between the application and the browser history.

When an event needs to be stored in the history, the place method of PlaceService is called. This method will transform the event to an history token the following way:

myurl#eventName?params

where params is the string returned by the handling method of the history converter for the event.
If params is null, then the URL will be:

myurl#eventName

In case an event of a child module is stored, its history name and history names of all its ascendant except the Root Module will be stored in the token:

myurl#childModule/subChildModule/eventName?params

By default "?" is used to seperate the event name from the parameters. You can change it thanks to @HistoryConfiguration.

If the token generated is supposed to be crawlable, then a "!" will be added before the token.

PlaceService

public PlaceService()
Build a PlaceService.

PlaceService

protected PlaceService(HistoryProxy history)
Build a PlaceService and inject an HistoryProxy instance.

This constructor is handy when you want to test PlaceService without using the GWT History class.
It shouldn't be called otherwise.

Parameters:
history - history proxy to inject
Method Detail

onValueChange

public void onValueChange(com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ValueChangeEvent<java.lang.String> event)
Called when the History token has changed.

Decode the history token and call the convertFromToken method of the history converters associated with this action stored in the token.

If token is equal to empty string, ask the event bus to dispatch an initEvent.

Specified by:
onValueChange in interface com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ValueChangeHandler<java.lang.String>
Parameters:
event - event containing the new history token

Parameters:
token - the token to convert

parseToken

protected java.lang.String[] parseToken(java.lang.String token)
Parse the token and return a string array. The first element of this array contains the event name whereas the second element contains the parameters associated to the event.

Parameters:
token - token to parse
Returns:
array of string

forwardToChildModuleIfNeeded

protected boolean forwardToChildModuleIfNeeded(java.lang.String eventName,
                                               java.lang.String param)
Check if this event is a child's module event. If it's the case, forward the token to the child module and return true.

Parameters:
eventName - name of the event that was stored in the token
param - parameters stored in the token
Returns:
true if this child module's event.

place

public java.lang.String place(java.lang.String eventName,
                              java.lang.String param,
                              boolean onlyToken)
Convert an event and its associated parameters to a token.

Parameters:
eventName - name of the event to store
param - string representation of the objects associated with the event that needs to be stored in the token
onlyToken - if true, only the token will be generated and browser history won't change
Returns:
the generated token

sendNotFoundEvent

protected void sendNotFoundEvent(Mvp4gModule module)
Calls not found event. By default it will called a root module event, but you can override the method if you want to call some specific event for child module

Parameters:
module - the last module where event wasn't found. If you will have a correct historyName at the begin of url, then this will be a child module, else rootModule.
